citations.narrative:
A primary enclosure is in need of maintenance or repair. The covered portion of the primary enclosure housing an adult
male white rhinoceros has a metal framed door at the back of the enclosure. The door is made of heavy, square, metal
bars. There is a horizontal bar across the top, bottom, and center of the door. There are also several vertical metal bars
spaced approximately 6 inches apart. In addition to the metal frame, there are numerous horizontal wooden boards
approximately 1 inch thick and 6 inches wide that help create a visible barrier for the rhinoceros. Some of the horizontal
boards at the lower portion of the door were broken with missing pieces that left sharp jagged edges. As inspectors
walked past this door, the rhinoceros was observed hitting the door with his lower horn, in the damaged area.
Failure to maintain facilities and enclosures in good repair can lead to animal injuries and escapes.
The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to
contain the animals. To be corrected by 23 May 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Shawna Abrams, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
A primary enclosure is in need of maintenance or repair. The covered portion of the primary enclosure housing an adult 
male white rhinoceros has a metal framed door at the back of the enclosure. The door is made of heavy, square, metal 
bars. There is a horizontal bar across the top, bottom, and center of the door. There are also several vertical metal bars 
spaced approximately 6 inches apart. In addition to the metal frame, there are numerous horizontal wooden boards 
approximately 1 inch thick and 6 inches wide that help create a visible barrier for the rhinoceros. Some of the horizontal 
boards at the lower portion of the door were broken with missing pieces that left sharp jagged edges. As inspectors 
walked past this door, the rhinoceros was observed hitting the door with his lower horn, in the damaged area. 
 
Failure to maintain facilities and enclosures in good repair can lead to animal injuries and escapes. 
 
The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to 
contain the animals. To be corrected by 23 May 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Shawna Abrams, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
